data.name: Ahmad 'Ali As'ad 'Ashirat Salah
data.notes: Shot dead by soldiers along with another minor near the Separation Barrier, according to the military after they threw Molotov cocktails at Route 60. In a video published on social media, an ambulance is seen at the site and gunfire is heard. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Muhammad Khaled 'Alian 'Issa
data.notes: Shot dead by soldiers along with another minor near the Separation Barrier, according to the military after they threw Molotov cocktails at Route 60. In a video published on social media, an ambulance is seen at the site and gunfire is heard. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Ibrahim 'Imad Ahmad Hamran
data.notes: Shot by soldiers while standing on a hill together with four other teens and throwing stones at military vehicles withdrawing from the nearby town of Qabatiyah. Soldiers got out of the vehicles, chased the teens through olive groves and fired at them. The other boys fled toward the town. About an hour after the shooting, paramedics arrived at the site and the soldiers directed them to Hamran’s body. They took him to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Ibrahim Majed 'Ali Naser
data.notes: Shot by soldiers who raided a house at the entrance to the town. Naser and two other minors threw stones at the military jeep parked near the house. He was shot and injured and fled into an olive grove, where he fell down. He was taken by paramedics to a hospital in Jenin, where he was pronounced dead. The two other minors fled the site. CCTV footage shows soldiers chasing the youths and firing.

data.name: Muhammad Khaled Hassan Mabruk
data.notes: Shot and injured in the thigh by Israeli forces who raided the city of Nablus for about twenty hours to arrest a Palestinian, while he was standing in an alley at the entrance to the camp together with his cousin, a minor. A military, Border Police and Shin Bet force raided a house in the city, detonated explosives nearby and arrested its owner. The forces raided the Rafidiya and al-Arabi hospitals searching for the wanted man, who was later arrested. During the raid, clashes broke out in various parts of the city, in which Palestinians threw stones at the forces. While a military jeep and a Border Police jeep were driving, forces fired at people standing at the camp entrance, injuring Mabruk and another Palestinian. A resident carried him on foot to an ambulance waiting nearby. Died of his wounds about three days later at al-Arabi Hospital.

data.name: 'Amru 'Ali Ahmad Qabha
data.notes: Shot by soldiers who got out of two military vehicles that entered the northern part of the town. Qabha, who was walking along the street, tried to escape when he noticed the soldiers, who called on him to stop, and they began shooting at him. His father arrived and approached him, and soldiers assaulted him, tied his hands, and seated him next to his dying son. For about half an hour, the soldiers prevented an ambulance at the site from evacuating him. Pronounced dead at a medical center in the town.

data.name: Iyad 'Abd al-Mu'ti Iyad Shalakhti
data.notes: Injured by soldiers' gunfire together with two other minors while throwing stones during the withdrawal of Israeli forces from Nablus. Taken by private car to Rafidiya Hospital in the city, where he died of his wounds about three days later. Two other minors were injured by the soldiers' gunfire.

data.name: Amjad Nassar Shihadah 'Awwad
data.notes: Shot by soldiers while participating in clashes at Manara Square in the city center, in which youths threw stones and fired fireworks at the soldiers. The clashes broke out after military and police counterterrorism (Yamam) forces raided a house on a nearby street, interrogated a Palestinian and arrested him. Afterwards, the forces raided another house in the Ein Musbah neighborhood in the northwest of the city and arrested four Palestinian citizens of Israel who had fled to Ramallah on criminal grounds. Evacuated by ambulance to a hospital in the city, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Rayan Tamer Anwar Hushiyeh
data.notes: Shot by soldiers who climbed onto the roof of a building in the center of the town during clashes that developed after they entered and surrounded a house to arrest a Palestinian. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones and IEDs at the soldiers. Hushiyeh was trying to cross the road on his way home with his cousin, a minor, when he was shot by the soldiers. He was taken by residents to a nearby ambulance and then to a clinic in the town, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: 'Ammar Mu'taz Mustafa Hamayel
data.notes: Shot in the back by soldiers after he threw a stone at an armored vehicle coming from the direction of Route 449. His friend, a minor, who was with him fled the scene after seeing Hamayel fall. Hamayel was evacuated, deceased, in a Palestinian ambulance that arrived at the scene following coordination with the DCO, and pronounced dead at a hospital in the city of Ramallah.

data.name: Yusef Fouad 'Abd al-Karim Fuqaha
data.notes: Shot by soldiers in ambush in farm fields near Rotue 5056, and evacuated in a military vehicle from which he was transferred to an Israeli ambulance. After the shooting, soldiers raided a house overlooking the spot where the shooting took place, viewed the security camera footage, and then deleted it. According to the military, Fuqaha tried to throw stones at the road. However, according to the witness with the security cameras, the footage showed he did not hold or throw any stones. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Nidal Wael 'Abd al-Karim a-Shaghnubi
data.notes: Shot by soldiers from an ambush while throwing stones on Highway 60 along with two other minors who were injured, fled, and were evacuated by local residents to ambulances waiting in the nearby village of ‘Asirah a-Shamaliyah, which took them to a hospital in the city of Nablus. Locals searching for a-Shaghnubi were unable to get close due to the presence of soldiers, who fired in the air and prevented his evacuation by ambulance. About two hours after the shooting, the Palestinian DCO was informed that a-Shaghnubi had died of his wounds. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Muhammad Nidal Majed Abu Libdah
data.notes: Shot by Israel Police officers at Bab al-Silsila (the Gate of the Chain in Temple Mount) in the Old City of Jerusalem. The police claimed he was shot after stabbing and moderately wounding a police officer. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Rida Mahmoud Kamal Bani 'Odeh
data.notes: Killed along with four other Palestinians, during a fire exchange with soldiers who raided the town, surrounded the three-story building in which they had barricaded themselves and fired shoulder-fired missiles at it. During the operation, the Israeli forces destroyed a significant portion of the building, rendering it uninhabitable. At the end of the operation, a military bulldozer scooped Bani ‘Odeh’s body and three others into its bucket and drove with them in it through the streets of the town and nearby communities. According to the military, four Palestinians were arrested in the town and the nearby city of Tubas during the raid. Bani ‘Odeh was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: 'Abd al-Khaleq Mus'ab 'Abd al-Khaleq 'Abd al-Khaleq
data.notes: Shot in the chest after closing his family's grocery store when military jeeps were reported in the village. Soldiers who got out of the jeeps approached the grocery store under cover of a grove and shot him from a distance of about 50 meters immediately after he stepped out. When some young men tried to evacuate him, the soldiers ordered them to back away, and allowed his evacuation only after trying unsuccessfully to provide first aid, but then blocked the path of the car in which he was being evacuated, forcing the driver to take a detour. ‘Abd al-Khaleq was pronounced dead in a hospital in Nablus.

data.name: Mahmoud Mithqal 'Ali Abu al-Heija
data.notes: Shot by soldiers who raided a house in the southern neighborhood of the town, while throwing stones at the house along with other minors from a distance of about 50 meters. Taken by car to the clinic in town and then by ambulance to a hospital in the city of Jenin, where he was pronounced dead.

data.name: Jihad Adham 'Abdallah 'Adili
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in ambush along with another Palestinian, while the two were throwing stones at Route 505. A third Palestinian who was with them was unharmed. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Malek 'Ali Ibrahim Hattab
data.notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers on a balcony on the second floor of a building on the main street in the camp, as he tried to escape with other youths from two military jeeps after some youths threw stones at them. A woman in a nearby house tried to rescue Hattab but was forced to return home because of the shooting. Two more Palestinians were wounded by the soldiers’ fire, including a minor. Hattab was taken to al-Istishari Hospital in the city of Ramallah where he underwent surgery, but after several hours, the doctors were forced to pronounce him dead.

data.name: 'Amer Muhammad Sa'adah Rabi'
data.notes: פלסטיני בעל אזרחות אמריקאית. נורה בידי חיילים ממארב יחד עם שני נערים נוספים, שנפצעו מהירי ונמלטו, לאחר שלפחות אחד מהשלושה יידה ככל הנראה אבן לעבר כביש 60, ממטע בקצה העיירה. חבריו לא יכלו לפנותו משום שהירי נמשך. החיילים ניסו ככל הנראה להגיש לו עזרה ראשונה אך הוא מת מפצעיו. גופתו נלקחה מהמקום בידי החיילים ונמסרה באותו ערב לאביו ולצוות הסהר האדום במחנה הצבאי חווארה.

data.name: 'Omar 'Amer Yasser Zyud
data.notes: Shot in the back by soldiers at the entrance to town. Zyud and other young men threw stones and IEDs at two armored military vehicles that entered the town, and the soldiers fired at them from a machine gun mounted on one of them and left the scene a few minutes later. Two more minors were injured by soldiers' gunfire at the scene, and another Palestinian was injured by gunfire during clashes that developed in another neighborhood in the town. Zyud was taken by ambulance to Ibn Sina Hospital in the city of Jenin, where he was pronounced dead.
